inclusionNote.lang: Tripple Click (B) Button

description.lang: Es kann festgelegt werden, nach welcher Zeit Ein Signal am Eingang 1 einen Alarm auslösen soll. Verschwindet die Alarmbedingung in dieser Zeit, wird kein Alarm ausgelöst.
defines the delay from triggering Input 1 to sending an alarm. Removing Alarm condition will cancel alarm
Es kann festgelegt werden, nach welcher Zeit Ein Signal am Eingang 2 einen Alarm auslösen soll. Verschwindet die Alarmbedingung in dieser Zeit, wird kein Alarm ausgelöst.
defines the delay from triggering Input 2 to sending an alarm. Removing Alarm condition will cancel alarm

name.lang: Type of control frame activated via IN input 1

description.lang: erlaubt die Art der Alarmmeldung des Einganges 1 zu spezifizieren.
The parameter allows you to specify the type of an alarm frame for Input 1

name.lang: Type of control frame activated via IN input 2

description.lang: erlaubt die Art der Alarmmeldung des Einganges 2 zu spezifizieren.
The parameter allows you to specify the type of an alarm frame for Input 2

name.lang: Dimmer/Motorsteuerung Niveau bei Alarmsteuerung am Eingang 1
Value of the parameter specifying the forced level of dimming/opening roller blinds from Input 1

description.lang: Im Alarmfall wird eine Alarmmeldung ausgesendet und es kann ein Aktor geschaltet werden. Für Dimmer und Jalousiecontroller kann definiert werden, auf welches Dimmerniveau oder welche Motorposition der Aktor gesteuert werden soll

In case of alarm frames an alarm priority is specified. Value of 255 makes it possible to activate a device. In case of the Dimmer module it means activating the device and setting it to the previously stored condition, e.g. when Dimmer is set to 30%, deactivated and then reactivated using 255 commend, it will be automatically set to the previous condition i.e. 30%.

name.lang: Dimmer/Motorsteuerung Niveau bei Alarmsteuerung am Eingang 2
Value of the parameter specifying the forced level of dimming/opening roller blinds from Input 2

description.lang: Im Alarmfall wird eine Alarmmeldung ausgesendet und es kann ein Aktor geschaltet werden. Für Dimmer und Jalousiecontroller kann definiert werden, auf welches Dimmerniveau oder welche Motorposition der Aktor gesteuert werden soll

In case of alarm frames an alarm priority is specified. Value of 255 makes it possible to activate a device. In case of the Dimmer module it means activating the device and setting it to the previously stored condition, e.g. when Dimmer is set to 30%, deactivated and then reactivated using 255 commend, it will be automatically set to the previous condition i.e. 30%.

name.lang: Deactivating transmission of the alarm cancelling frame or the control frame deactivating the device (Basic)
Отправлять устройствам из группы 1 сигнал тревоги или команду отключения

description.lang: Es wird definiert, das Verschwinden der Alarmbedingung zum erneuten Schalten eines Aktors oder zum Aussenden einer Alarmdeaktivierungsnachricht führen soll
It allows for disabling the function of deactivating the device and cancelling alarms for devices associated with IN input.

Deactivating transmission of the alarm cancelling frame or the control frame deactivating the device (Basic). It allows for disabling the function of deactivating the device and cancelling alarms for devices associated with IN input.
Information wird gesendet an Gruppe 1 und Gruppe 2
information is sent to group 1 and 2
Information wird nicht gesendet für Gruppe 2 und gesendet für Gruppe 1
information is not sent for group 2 but sent for group 1
Information wird nicht gesendet für Gruppe 1 und gesendet für Gruppe 2
information is not sent for group 1 but sent for group 2

name.lang: Trigger level to send out temperature report
Параметр №12 - Отправлять отчет при изменении температуры на Температура = значение/16

description.lang: Es wird die Abweichung der gemessenen Temperatur zur letzten per Funk gesendeten Temperatur definiert, die zu einem erneuten Report der Temperatur an die Geräte in Assoziationsgruppe 3 führt. Ist der Wert = Null, wird ein Temperatur mindestens aller 4 Minuten oder bei jedem Aufweckintervall gesendet.

defines the maximum deviation of the actual temperature compared to the last wirelessly reported temperature to create a new wireless report to the device in association group 3. If set to zero a report will be generated at every regular wakeup of the device but as a minimum every 4 minutes.

Если с последнего замера температура изменилась больше чем на заданное значение, например 0.5 градусов, то будет отправлен отчет устройству из группы 3. Значение для градусов Цельсия высчитывается по формуле: X = deltaT*16; X - нужное значение; deltaT - разница температур (например 0.5); Если мы хотим получать отчет при изменении температуры на 0.5 градусов формула такова: 8 = 0.5*15. Если задано значение 0 и интервал пробуждения 255 секунд, то отчет о температуре будет присылаться при пробуждении (каждые 255 секунд). Если задано 0 и интервал пробуждения больше 255, то отчет будет присылаться каждые 4 минуты.

name.lang: Sending an alarm or control frame (for IN input, depending on parameter no.5 value), and TMP button alarm frame
Отправлять широковещательные сообщения от IN и TMP

description.lang: Definiert, wie Alarmmeldungen gesendet werden. Nachrichten im Broadcast Mode werden von allen umgebenden Geräten empfangen jedoch nicht geroutet.
The frame is sent in “broadcast” mode, i.e. to all devices within range - information sent in this mode is not repeated by the mesh network.
Широковещательные сообщения отправляются всем устройствам в сети.
IN1 and IN2 Broadcast mode inactive
от IN1 не отправлять, от IN2 не отправлять
IN1 Broadcast aktiv, IN2 Broadcast inaktiv
IN1 broadcast mode active, IN2 broadcast mode inactive
от IN1 отправлять, от IN2 не отправлять
IN1 Broadcase inakiv und IN2 Broadcast aktiv
IN1 broadcast mode inactive, IN2 broadcast mode active
от IN1 не отправлять, от IN2 отправлять
IN1 and IN2 broadcast mode active
от IN1 отправлять, от IN2 отправлять

von "AUS" nach "EIN" generiert id 10, von "EIN" nach "AUS" generiert id 11, Taste gedrückt halten generiert id 12, Loslassen generiert id 13, Doppelklick generiert id 14, Dreifachklick generiert id 15: Achtung: Szenenaktivierung entlädt die Batterie schneller.

IN input: Switch from “off” to “on” ID10; Switch from “on” to “off” ID11; Remaining IDs are recognized correctly if the value of parameter no.3 was set to 2 Holding down ID12; Releasing ID13; Double click ID14; Triple click ID 15; Scene activation functionality may shorten the battery life, even by 25%.

Это устройство позволяет выполнять сцены. Команды на выполнения сцен отправляются устройствам находящимся в группе 3. Контроллеры, такие как Home Center 2, Z-Box понимают эти команды и могут исполнить сцену, ID которой указан в команде. Нажатие кнопки подключенной к IN отправляет определенный ID. Таким образом можно по двойному нажатию запускать сцену "Включить везде свет", а по тройному "Выключить везде свет". Для бистабильного выключателя: ID 10 - переключение с ВЫКЛ на ВКЛ; ID 11 - переключение с ВКЛ на ВЫКЛ. Для моностабильного выключателя: ID 12 - удержание; ID 13 - отпускание; ID 14 - двойное нажатие; ID 15 - тройное нажатие.

name.lang: Interval des periodischen Erfassens aller Temperaturwerte
Interval between Readings of all temperature sensors

description.lang: The Universal Binary Sensor is a wireless module that makes it possible to improve the functionality of any sensor with a binary output by allowing it to communicate with the wireless network Z-WAVE

inclusionNote.lang: Triple press B button

description.lang: Group I is assigned to input IN1
Group II is assigned to input IN2
Group III reports on the condition of the device, only one device may be assigned to the group.
Additional delay after an alarm from input IN1 has ceased. The parameter allows you to specify additional time, after which the input no. 1 alarm is cancelled once its violation has ceased.
Additional delay after an alarm from input IN2 has ceased. The parameter allows you to specify additional time, after which the input no. 2 alarm is cancelled once its violation has ceased.

name.lang: Type of transmitted control frame for association group 1, activated via input IN1.

description.lang: The parameter allows to specify the type of alarm frame or to force transmission of control commands (BASIC_SET)

name.lang: Type of transmitted control frame for association group 2, activated via input IN2

description.lang: The parameter allows to specify the type of alarm frame or to force transmission of control commands (BASIC_SET)

name.lang: Value of the parameter specifying the forced level of dimming / opening sun blinds when comes “switch on” / ”open” command to devices from association group no. 1.

description.lang: In the case of alarm frames the alarm priority is specified. Value of 255 makes it possible to activate the device when using the Dimmer module it means activating the device and setting it to the previous stored condition, e.g. when Dimmer is set to 30%, then deactivated, and then reactivated using command 255, it will automatically be set to the previous condition, i.e. 30%.

name.lang: Value of the parameter specifying the forced level of dimming / opening sun blinds when comes “switch on” / ”open” command to devices from association group no. 2.

description.lang: In the case of alarm frames the alarm priority is specified. Value of 255 makes it possible to activate the device; when using of the Dimmer module it means activating the device and setting it to the previous stored condition, e.g. when Dimmer is set to 30%, then deactivated, and then reactivated using command 255, it will automatically be set to the previous condition, i.e. 30%.

name.lang: Deactivating transmission of the frame cancelling the alarm or the control frame deactivating the device (Basic)

description.lang: It allows for disabling the deactivation function or the alarm cancellation function for devices associated with the appropriate input of the Fibaro Sensor. In the case of association group no. 1 and 2 the information is sent. sent. In the case of association group no. 2 the information is sent. NOTE: Information concerning alarm violation or activation commands for devices from association groups are always sent.
in the case of association group no. 1 and 2 the information is sent
in the case of association group no. 1 the information is sent. In the case of association group no. 2 the information is not sent.
in the case of association group no. 1 the information is not sent. In the case of association group no. 2 the information is sent.

name.lang: Interval between successive readings of temperature from all sensors connected to the device

description.lang: Note: taking temperature readings from the sensor does not result in sending a temperature condition report to the central hub.

name.lang: Interval between forcing to send report concerning the temperature conditions

description.lang: The forced report is sent immediately after the next reading of temperature from the sensor, irrespective of the settings of parameter no. 12. Note: Frequent sending of temperature condition reports is reasonable when the sensor is located somewhere where can occure rapid changes of ambient temperature. In other cases it is recommended to leave the parameter set to the default value.

This is the maximum acceptable difference between the last reported temperature and the current temperature taken from the sensor. If the temperatures differ by the set value or more, then a report with the current temperature value is sent to the device assigned to association group no. 3. Intervals between taking readings from sensors are specified by parameter no. 10. Default value: 8 [0.5oC] Possible parameter settings:0 – 255 [0oC to 16oC] [0 oF – 28.8oF] In order to set the appropriate value of the parameter, the following formula should be used: x = delta T x 16 - for Celsius x = delta T x 80 / 9 - for Fahrenheit x – parameter value delta T – maximum acceptable temperature gradient in Celsius or Fahrenheit If the value is set to 0, then information about the temperature will be sent every time, immediately once the readings have been taken from the sensor.

name.lang: Transmitting the alarm or control frame in “broadcast” mode (i.e. to all devices within range)

description.lang: Information sent in this mode is not repeated by the mesh network. NOTE! If the “broadcast” mode of information transmission is activated for a given channel, then transmission of information in “singlecast” mode to devices assigned to the association group of this channel is deactivated.
IN1 broadcast mode active, Sensor 2 broadcast mode inactive
IN1 broadcast mode inactive, Sensor 2 broadcast mode active
INI and IN2 broadcast mode active

NOTE!!! Inputs IN1 and IN2 are used to control the condition of the device. Each of them may force two conditions for corresponding device channels: on / alarm, off / no alarm. If monostable keys are used and the value of parameter no. 3 or no. 4 is set to 2, change of the state of corresponding channel will be able after a single click.

inclusionNote.lang: Triple click the B button, located on the Plug's casing

description.lang: III association group reports relay's status to just one device, Z-Wave network's main controller by default. It's not recommended to modify settings of this association group.
II association group allows for sending control commands to associated devices depending on the current load. This association group is configured through the advanced parameters no. 50, 51 and 52.
I association group is assigned to Plugs status - On / Off. Allows for sending control command to associated devices whenever the Plug is turned On or Off.

Once activated, Wall Plug will keep a connected device constantly ON, will stop reacting to alarm frames and B-button push. "Always on" function turns the Plug into a power and energy meter. Also, connected device will not be turned off upon receiving an alarm frame from another Z-Wave device (parameter 35 will be ignored). In "Always on" mode, connected device may be turned off only after user defined power has been exceeded (parameter 70). In such a case, connected device can be turned on again by pushing the B-button or sending a control frame. By default, overload protection is inactive.

name.lang: Remember device status after power failure

description.lang: Define how will the Plug react after the power supply is back on. Default setting: 1 Available settings: 0 - Wall Plug does not memorize its state after a power failure. Connected device will be off after the power supply is reconnected. 1 - Wall Plug memorizes its state after a power failure.
Wall Plug does not memorize its state after a power failure. Connected device will be off after the power supply is reconnected.
Wall Plug memorizes its state after a power failure.

Define Z-Wave network alarms to which the Wall Plug will respond. Available settings: 0 - 63. 1 - general alarm, 2 - smoke alarm, 4 - CO alarm, 8 - CO2 alarm, 16 - high temperature alarm, 32 - flood alarm, 63 - device responds to all types of alarm frames. Set value may be a sum of available values, e.g. set value = 5 means the Plug will respond to general alarm (1) and CO alarm (4).
Set the alarm reactions the wall plug is responding to.

name.lang: Wall Plug's response to alarm frames

description.lang: Parameter defines how the Wall Plug will respond to alarms (device's status change)
turn on connected device. LED ring signals an alarm through defined time period (parameter 39) or untill the alarm is cancelled
turn off connected device. LED ring signals an alarm through defined time period (parameter 39) or untill the alarm is cancelled

cyclically change device state, each 1second. In alarm mode Wall Plug does not report status change, power changes, ignores alarm frames. After the defined time period has passed (parameter 39) or after the alarm cancellation, connected device is set to the previous state

Wall Plug's alarm mode duration. If a device sending an alarm frame through the Z-Wave network sets alarm duration as well, this parameter's settings are ignored. Available settings: 1 - 65536 (seconds)

Parameter defines by how much power load must change, in percents, to be reported to the main controller, with the highest priority in the Z-Wave network. By default, Fibaro Wall Plug immediately sends power report if the power load changes by 80%. Available settings: 1 - 100 (%). Value of 100 (%) means the reports are turned off.
Define a percentage by which a report is sent to the controller.

Parameter defines by how much power load must change, in percents, to be reported to the main controller. By default, Fibaro Wall Plug sends power report if the power load changes by 15%. By default such changes in power load may be reported up to 5 times per 30 seconds. Wall Plug sends 5 reports during time period specified in paramater 43. Available settings: 1 - 100 (%) Value of 100 (%) means the reports are turned off.

This parameter defines how frequently standard power reports (parameter 42) will be sent. By default Wall Plug sends up to 5 reports each 30 seconds, provided the power load changes by 15%. Available settings: 1 - 254 (s) Value of 255 - Reports will be sent only as a result of parameter 47 settings or in case of polling.
Reports will be sent only as a result of parameter 47 settings or in case of polling.

name.lang: Reporting changes in energy consumed by controlled devices

description.lang: New, reported energy value is calculated based on last reported value. Available settings: 1 - 254 (0,01kWh - 2,54kWh). Value of 255 - changes in consumed energy will not be reported. Reports will be sent only in case of polling.
Changes in consumed energy will not be reported. Reports will be sent only in case of polling.

name.lang: Time period between reports on power load and energy consumption

description.lang: Parameter defines time period between reports sent when changes in power load have not been recorded. By default, if power load changes have not been recorded, reports are sent every hour. Available settings: 1 - 65534 (s) Value of 65535 - no periodic reports. Reports will be sent only in case of power load / energy consumption changes (parameters 40, 42, 43,45) or in case of polling.
No periodic reports. Reports will be sent only in case of power load / energy consumption changes (parameters 40, 42, 43,45) or in case of polling.

name.lang: Metering energy consumed by the Wall Plug itself

description.lang: This parameter determines whether energy metering should include the amount of energy consumed by the Wall Plug itself. Results are being added to energy consumed by controlled device. Available settings: 0 - function inactive, 1 - function activated.
Lower power threshold, used in parameter 52. Available settings: 0 - 25 000 (0,0W - 2 500W) DOWN value cannot be higher than a value specified in parameter 51.
Upper power threshold, used in parameter 52. Available settings: 1 - 25 000 (0,1W - 2 500W) UP value cannot be lower than a value specified in parameter 50.

name.lang: Action in case of exceeding defined power values (parameters 50 and 51)

description.lang: Parameter deifines the way 2nd association group devices are controlled, depending on the current power load.
Turn the associated devices on, once the power drops below DOWN value (parameter 50).
Turn the associated devices off, once the power drops below DOWN value (parameter 50).
Turn the associated devices on, once the power rises above UP value (parameter 51).
Turn the associated devices off, once the power rises above UP value (parameter 51).
1 and 4 combined. Turn the associated devices on, once the power drops below DOWN value (parameter 50). Turn the associated devices off, once the power rises above UP value (parameter 51).
2 and 3 combined. Turn the associated devices off, once the power drops below DOWN value (parameter 50). Turn the associated devices on, once the power rises above UP value (parameter 51).

name.lang: Power load, which when exceeded, makes the LED ring flash violet

description.lang: Function is active only when parameter 61 is set to 0 or 1. Available settings: 1 000 - 32 000 (100W - 3200W).

name.lang: LED ring illumination colour when controlled device is on.

description.lang: LED ring illumination colour changes in predefined steps, depending on power consumption changes.
LED ring illumination colour changes continuously, using full spectrum of available colorus, depending on power consumption changes.

name.lang: LED ring illumination color when controlled device is off.

description.lang: LED ring is illuminated with a color corresponding to the last measured power, before the controlled device was turned off.

name.lang: LED ring illumination colour at the Z-Wave network alarm detection

description.lang: No change in colour. LED ring illumination colour determined by parameters 61 or 62 settings.
LED ring flashes red / blue / white (default).

This function allows for turning off the controlled device in case of exceeding the defined power. Controlled device will be turned off even if "always on" function is active (parameter 1). Controlled device can be turned back on via B-button or sending a control frame. By default this function is inactive. Available settings: 10 - 65 535 (1W - 6 553,5W). Value higher than 32 000 (3 200W) turns the overload safety switch off, i.e. this functionality is turned off by default. Default setting: 65 535 (6 553,5W)

wakeupNote.lang: Pressing the TMP button.

inclusionNote.lang: The Fibaro Door/Window Sensor is added to the network by quickly pressing the TMP button three times (the button is located on the underside of the device, inside its casing).One of the buttons needs to be pressed constantly.

description.lang: Group III reports on the condition of the device, only one device may be assigned to the group (main controller, by default).
Group II is assigned to TMP button. Once the button is released, ALARM GENERIC frame is sent to associated devices.
Group I is assigned to input IN1 (and the magnetic sensor). Sending BASIC SET or ALARM command frames.

Additional delay after an alarm from input IN has ceased. The parameter allows user to specify additional time, after which the input IN alarm is cancelled once its violation has ceased.
Available parameter settings: 0 – 65535 s
Define the additional time delay, if the violation has ceased.
The parameter defines the type of IN input.

name.lang: Type of control frame transmitted for association group 1, activated via IN input.

description.lang: The parameter allows you to specify the type of an alarm frame or to force control frames transmission (BASIC_SET) Default value: 255 – BASIC SET

name.lang: Forced level of dimming/opening roller blinds

description.lang:
Value of the parameter specifying the forced level of dimming/opening roller blinds when “switch on”/”open” commands are sent to devices from association group no.1.
In case of alarm frames an alarm priority is specified. Default value: 255
Value of 255 makes it possible to activate a device. In case of the Dimmer module it means activating the device and setting it to the previously stored condition, e.g. when Dimmer is set to 30%, deactivated and then reactivated using 255 commend, it will be automatically set to the previous condition i.e. 30%.
the parameter defines the level of dimming/opening associated devices.

Deactivating transmission of the alarm cancelling frame or the control frame deactivating the device (Basic). It allows for disabling the function of deactivating the device and cancelling alarms for devices associated with IN input.
For association group no. 1 information is sent
For association group no. 1 information is not sent.
The parameter defines if the tamper alarm cancellation is active or inactive.

The maximum acceptable difference between the last reported temperature and the current temperature read from the sensor. If the temperatures differ by the set value or more, a report with the current temperature value is sent to the device assigned to association group no. 3. Default value: 8 [0,5°C] Available parameter settings: 0 – 255 [0°C to 16°C] [32°F – 60,8°F] To set an appropriate parameter value use the following formula: x = delta T x 16 - for Celsius x = delta T x 80 / 9 - for Fahrenheit x = parameter value delta T – maximum acceptable temperature gradient in Celsius or Fahrenheit If the value is set to 0: - if the wake-up interval is set to 255 seconds, temperature report will be sent according to the interval, - if the wake-up interval is set to over 255, temperature report will be sent each ca. 4 minutes.
Define the parameter for the maximum accaeptable difference.

Sending an alarm or control frame (for IN input, depending on parameter no.5 value), and TMP button alarm frame. The frame is sent in “broadcast” mode, i.e. to all devices within range - information sent in this mode is not repeated by the mesh network.
Note: If the “broadcast” mode of information transmission is activated for a given channel, then transmission of information in “singlecast” mode, i.e. to devices assigned to the association group, for this channel is deactivated.
IN and TMP Broadcast mode inactive
IN broadcast mode active, TMP broadcast mode inactive
IN broadcast mode inactive, TMP broadcast mode active
IN and TMP broadcast mode active

The device offers the possibility of sending commands compatible with Command class scene activation. Information is sent to devices assigned to association group no. 3 Controllers such as the Home Center 2 are able to interpret such commands and based on these commands activate scenes, to which specific scene IDs have been assigned. The user may expand the functionality of a button connected to IN input by distinguishing the sequence of it being pushed. For example: double click would trigger the “goodnight” scene and triple click would trigger the “morning” scene. To fully use the possibilities offered by the parameter no.14 it is recommended to use a momentary or a toggle switch (parameter no.3). Scene ID is determined in the following manner: IN input: Switch from “off” to “on” ID10 Switch from “on” to “off” ID11 Remaining IDs are recognized correctly if the value of parameter no.3 was set to 2 Holding down ID12 Releasing ID13 Double click ID14 Triple click ID15

name.lang: READ ONLY Parameter - can not set values

description.lang: The parameter value is automatically sent to the association group III if the connected sensor DS18B20 four times mistakenly read the temperature. In case of Wake Up Interval set for 4000 seconds temperature sensor will be checked every 5 minutes.

inclusionNote.lang: Make sure that Sensor's cover is closed. Find the TMP button located on the underside of the device, which allows for proper inclusion. Set the main Z-Wave controller into the learning mode (see main controller’s operating manual).

description.lang: „Tamper ZW3” is assigned to the tamper alarm. Alarm frame will be send to associated devices once tampering has been detected.
“Sensor ZW3” is assigned to the magnetic sensor and IN input. Opening or closing will result in sending BASIC SET control command to associated devices.
“Alarm” reports alarms. Alarm frame will be sent to associated devices once such an event has been detected. Its value may be modified in the advanced parameters.
„Control” pis assigned to the magnetic sensor and IN input. Opening or closing will result in sending BASIC SET control command to associated devices.
Door/Window Sensor or external alarm sensor (type - see par. 20)
Parameter defines state of the sensor when the magnet is close. If you connect the alarm sensor, it determines the output type. Parameter inactive in Switch Mode (parameter 1 set to 1).

Paramater defines events indicated by the LED. Reducing number of them results in longer battery lifetime. Available settings: 0 - 7 Default setting: 6 (indication of wake up and device tampering) Parameter values may be combined, e.g. 1+2+4=7, means that all indications are enabled.
0 - no indications 1 - indication of opening/closing status change (input IN) 2 - indication of wake up (1 x click or using time interval) 4 - indication of device tampering

name.lang: Z-WAVE RANGE TEST AFTER DOUBLE TMP CLICK

description.lang: Parameter defines events which results in sending on/off commands to devices added to the 2nd association group. They are sent alternately and represent the values of BASIC SET command frames. Parameter is inactive in Switch Mode (parameter 1 set to 1).
Command frames sent to devices added to the 2nd association group.
The value of 0 turns OFF the device, 255 turns it ON. In case of associating the Dimmer or Roller Shutter module, values 1-99 allow to set an associated device to a specified level.
Define a value for an associated Dimmer or Roller Shutter.
The value of 0 turns OFF the device, 255 turns it ON. In case of associating the Dimmer or Roller Shutter module, values 1-99 allow to set an associated device to a specified level.
Define a value for an associated Dimmer or Roller Shutter.
Time until sending ON command frame. Available settings: 0 - 32400 (time in seconds, max 9h)
Time until sending OFF command frame. Available settings: 0 - 32400 (time in seconds, max 9h)

name.lang: TYPE OF SENSOR CONNECTED TO IN INPUT

description.lang: Type of control frames transmitted to the main controller. If the external sensor is connected to IN input, it is possible to choose its functionality. This way alarm commands are sent to the 3rd association group „Alarm”.
Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled. Available settings: 0 - 32400 (time in seconds, max 9h)
Define a time period to cancel the alarm.
Reporting the cancellation of tamper alarm to 5th association group.
Do not send tamper cancellation report

The parameter determines how often the temperature will be measured. The shorter the time, the more frequently the temperature will be measured, but the battery life will shorten. 5 - 32400 - time in seconds, 5 seconds - 9 hours
Define a time period to measure the temperature.
The parameter determines the change in level of temperature resulting in temperature report being sent to the main controller.
temperature reports based on threshold disabled
The parameter determines how often the temperature reports will be sent to the main controller. 5 - 32400 - time in seconds, 5 seconds - 9 hours
The value to be added to the actual temperature, measured by the sensor (temperature compensation). Available settings: -1000 - 1000 (-100°C – 100°C, in 0,1°C steps)
Define a value for temperature compensation.
Temperature alarms reported to the main Z-Wave controller. Thresholds may be set in parameters no. 55 and 56.

If temperature is higher than the set value, high temperature notification will be sent and high temperature scene will be triggered (if activated). Available settings: 0 - 1000 (0°C - 100°C, in 0,1°C steps)

If temperature is lower than the set value, low temperature notification will be sent and low temperature scene will be triggered (if activated). Available settings: -300 - 700 (-30°C - 70°C, in 0,1°C steps)

Activating each scene is performer by setting the bit mask. Each bit can activate a specified scene. To deactivate all scenes set every bit to 0 (parameter value 0). To activate all scenes set every bit to 1 (parameter value 3903). Available settings: 0 - 3903 (value determined on the basis of bitmask) Bit mask contains 16 bits which can be set to 0 (scene not active) or to 1 (scene active). In order to determine the parameter value depending on the activated scenes visit the Fibaro website.

Settings for broadcasting ON/OFF commands, sensor alarm and tamper alarm. Value other than 0 means alarms are sent in BROADCAST mode (with a priority over other communicates), to all devices within the Fibaro Door/Window Sensor’s range. They are not repeated by the mesh network. Create any combination of options by summing values of every chosen option.
0 - broadcasts inactive 1 - ON/OFF commands broadcast active 2 - sensor alarm broadcast active 4 - tamper alarm broadcast active

name.lang: ASSOCIATIONS IN Z-WAVE NETWORK SECURITY MODE

description.lang: This parameter defines how commands are sent in specified association groups: as secure or non-secure. Parameter is active only in Z-Wave network security mode. It does not apply to 1st group “Lifeline”. Create any combination of options by summing values of every chosen option.
0 - none of the groups sent as secure 1 - 2nd group ”Control” sent as secure 2 - 3rd group ”Alarm” sent as secure 4 - 4th group “Sensor ZW3” sent as secure 8 - 5th group “Tamper ZW3” sent as secure
battery powered Motion Sensor, Temperature Sensor, Light Sensor, Accelerometer

wakeupNote.lang: dreifaches schnelles Drücken der B-Taste im Gehäuseinneren
triple clicking the B-Button inside the case

inclusionNote.lang: dreifaches schnelles Drücken der B-Taste im Gehäuseinneren
triple clicking the B-Button inside the case

description.lang: sendet den Geätestatus nur an ein Gerät (normalerweise der Primärcontroller). Gruppe sollte nicht modifiziert werden.

reports the device status and allows for assigning a single device only (the main controller by default - the device reports its status to the main controller). It’s not recommended to modify this association group.
ist dem Manipulationsschutz zugewiesen. Sendet Alarm Frame an die assoziierten Geräte, wenn Manipulation entdeckt wird.
is assigned to the tamper alarm. Alarm frame will be sent to the associated devices once tampering is detected.
ist dem Gerätestatus zugewiesen - sendet BASIC SET Kommandos zu den assoziierten Geräten bei festgestellter Bewegung
is assigned to the device status - sending, the BASIC SET control frame to the associated devices having detected motion.
Je niedriger Wert, desto empfindlicher ist der PIR Sensor.
The lower the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor.
Zeitperiode, in der der PIR Sensor "blind" ist für Bewegungen. Nach dieser Zeit ist Sensor wieder aktiv.
Period of time through which the PIR sensor is “blind” (insensitive) to motion. After this time period the PIR sensor will be again able to detect motion.
standard 15 (= 8s); Zeit sollte kürzer eingestellt werden als Parameter 6.
default 15 (= 8sec); The time of insensitivity should be shorter that the time period set in parameter 6.
Legt die anzahl an Bewegungsimpulsen fest, die zum auslösen eines Motion Reports führen. Je niedriger der Wert, desto weniger empfindlich ist der PIR Sensor. Wert sollte nicht verändert werden.
Sets the number of moves required for the PIR sensor to report motion. The lower the value, the less sensitive the PIR sensor. It’s not recommended to modify this parameter settings.

Zeitperiode in der die in Parameter 3 festgelegten Impulse stattfinden müssen, um einen Motion Report auszulösen. Je höher der Wert, desto empfindlicher der Sensor. Wert sollte nicht verändert werden.

Period of time during which the number of moves set in parameter 3 must be detected in order for the PIR sensor to report motion. The higher the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor. It’s not recommended to modify this parameter setting.

Zeitperiode, nach der der Bewegungsalarm beendet wird für Primärcontroller und assoziierte Geräte. Jede neue festgestellte Bewegung in der Zeit started die Zeitperiode neu. Bei sehr niedrigen Werten (unter 10s) muss Parameter 2 angepasst werden.

Period of time, after the motion alarm will be cancelled in the main controller and the associated devices. Any motion detected during the cancellation delay time countdown will result in the countdown being restarted. In case of small values, below 10 seconds, the value of parameter 2 must be modified (PIR sensor’s “Blind Time”).
Parameter legt die Tageszeit fest, zu der der PIR Sensor aktiv ist. Parameter beeinflusst nur Bewegungssensor, nicht den Manipulationsschutz, Helligkeitssensor und Temperatursensor.

determines the part of day in which the PIR sensor will be active. parameter influences only the motion reports and associations. Tamper, light intensity and temperature measurements will not be influenced.
PIR Sensor nur am Tag aktiv
PIR sensor active during the day only
PIR Sensor nur in der Nacht aktiv
PIR sensor active during the night only
Parameter definiert Tag und Nacht anhand der Helligkeit für Parameter 8.
parameter defines the difference between night and day, in terms of light intensity, used in parameter 8.
Parameter definiert den Command Frame für die 1.Assoziationsgruppe des PIR Sensors.
parameter determines the command frames sent in 1-st association group, assigned to PIR sensor.
BASIC ON und BASIC OFF Command Frames wird in Basic Command Class gesendet.

description.lang: sendet den Geätestatus nur an ein Gerät (normalerweise der Primärcontroller). Gruppe sollte nicht modifiziert werden.

reports the device status and allows for assigning a single device only (the main controller by default - the device reports its status to the main controller). It’s not recommended to modify this association group.
ist dem Manipulationsschutz zugewiesen. Sendet Alarm Frame an die assoziierten Geräte, wenn Manipulation entdeckt wird.
is assigned to the tamper alarm. Alarm frame will be sent to the associated devices once tampering is detected.
ist dem Gerätestatus zugewiesen - sendet BASIC SET Kommandos zu den assoziierten Geräten bei festgestellter Bewegung
is assigned to the device status - sending, the BASIC SET control frame to the associated devices having detected motion.
Je niedriger Wert, desto empfindlicher ist der PIR Sensor.
The lower the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor.
Zeitperiode, in der der PIR Sensor "blind" ist für Bewegungen. Nach dieser Zeit ist Sensor wieder aktiv.
Period of time through which the PIR sensor is “blind” (insensitive) to motion. After this time period the PIR sensor will be again able to detect motion.
standard 15 (= 8s); Zeit sollte kürzer eingestellt werden als Parameter 6.

default 15 (= 8sec); The time of insensitivity should be shorter that the time period set in parameter 6. Formula to calculate the time: time [s] = 0.5 x (value + 1) Available settings: 0 - 15 (0,5 - 8 seconds)
Legt die anzahl an Bewegungsimpulsen fest, die zum auslösen eines Motion Reports führen. Je niedriger der Wert, desto weniger empfindlich ist der PIR Sensor. Wert sollte nicht verändert werden.
Sets the number of moves required for the PIR sensor to report motion. The lower the value, the less sensitive the PIR sensor. It’s not recommended to modify this parameter settings.

Zeitperiode in der die in Parameter 3 festgelegten Impulse stattfinden müssen, um einen Motion Report auszulösen. Je höher der Wert, desto empfindlicher der Sensor. Wert sollte nicht verändert werden.

Period of time during which the number of moves set in parameter 3 must be detected in order for the PIR sensor to report motion. The higher the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor. It’s not recommended to modify this parameter setting.
Define a time interval. Formula to calculate the time: time [s] = 4 x (value + 1) Default setting: 2 (12 seconds)

Zeitperiode, nach der der Bewegungsalarm beendet wird für Primärcontroller und assoziierte Geräte. Jede neue festgestellte Bewegung in der Zeit started die Zeitperiode neu. Bei sehr niedrigen Werten (unter 10s) muss Parameter 2 angepasst werden.

Period of time, after the motion alarm will be cancelled in the main controller and the associated devices. Any motion detected during the cancellation delay time countdown will result in the countdown being restarted. In case of small values, below 10 seconds, the value of parameter 2 must be modified (PIR sensor’s “Blind Time”).
Parameter legt die Tageszeit fest, zu der der PIR Sensor aktiv ist. Parameter beeinflusst nur Bewegungssensor, nicht den Manipulationsschutz, Helligkeitssensor und Temperatursensor.

determines the part of day in which the PIR sensor will be active. parameter influences only the motion reports and associations. Tamper, light intensity and temperature measurements will not be influenced.
PIR Sensor nur am Tag aktiv
PIR sensor active during the day only
PIR Sensor nur in der Nacht aktiv
PIR sensor active during the night only
Parameter definiert Tag und Nacht anhand der Helligkeit für Parameter 8.
parameter defines the difference between night and day, in terms of light intensity, used in parameter 8.

inclusionNote.lang: The Fibaro Motion Sensor can be included into the Z-Wave network by using the B-button. Quickly, triple click the B-button - LED diode will glow blue to confirm setting into learning mode.

description.lang: „Tamper BC” is assigned to the tamper alarm. Once tampering is detected or cancelled, nodes added to this group will receive alarm frames. This group aims to provide backward compatibility with devices not supporting the Z-Wave+ protocol. Only nodes not supporting the Z-wave+ protocol should be added to this group. The „Tamper BC” group can handle up to five devices (one or multi-channel). If Fibaro Motion Sensor operates in protected mode, outgoing messages are always encrypted.

„Motion BC” is assigned to the motion sensor. Once motion is detected or alarm state cancelled, nodes added to this group will receive report frames. This group aims to provide backward compatibility with controllers not supporting the Z-Wave+ protocol. Only a main controller not supporting the Z-wave+ protocol should be added to this group.
„Tamper” is assigned to the tamper alarm. Once tampering is detected or cancelled, nodes added to this group will receive alarm frames.

„Motion” is assigned to the motion sensor. At the moment of motion detection or alarm state cancellation, nodes added to this group will receive control frames. The „Motion” group can handle up to five devices (one or multi-channel). If Fibaro Motion Sensor operates in protected mode, outgoing messages are encrypted, depending on whether the added node also operates in secure mode.

„Lifeline” is a reporting group, assigned to the device status. Main Z-Wave+ network controller should be added to this group. The „Lifeline” group can handle only one device. If Fibaro Motion Sensor operates in protected mode, outgoing messages are always encrypted.
The lower the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor.

Period of time through which the PIR sensor is “blind” (insensitive) to motion. After this time period the PIR sensor will be again able to detect motion. The longer the insensitivity period, the longer the battery life. If the sensor is required to detect motion quickly, the time period may be shortened. The time of insensitivity should be shorter that the time period set in parameter 6 (cancellation delay).
Available settings: 0 - 15 (0,5 - 8 seconds) Define blind time.
Sets the number of moves required for the PIR sensor to report motion. The lower the value, the less sensitive the PIR sensor. It’s not recommended to modify this parameter settings.
Define amount of pulses. Formula to calculate the number of pulses: pulses = (value + 1)

Period of time during which the number of moves set in parameter 3 must be detected in order for the PIR sensor to report motion. The higher the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor. It’s not recommended to modify this parameter setting. Formula to calculate the time: time [s] = 4 x (value + 1)

Motion alarm will be cancelled in the main controller and the associated devices after the period of time set in this parameter. Any motion detected during the cancellation delay time countdown will result in the countdown being restarted. In case of small values, below 10 seconds, the value of parameter 2 must be modified (PIR sensor’s “Blind Time”).

The parameter determines the part of day in which the PIR sensor will be active. This parameter influences only the motion reports and associations. Tamper, light intensity and temperature measurements will be still active, regardless of this parameter settings.
PIR sensor active during the day only
PIR sensor active during the night only
The parameter defines the difference between night and day, in terms of light intensity, used in parameter 8.
Set the parameter for light intensity.

The parameter determines the command frames sent in 1-st association group, assigned to PIR sensor. Values of BASIC ON and BASIC OFF command frames may be modified by dedicated parameters (14 and 16).
BASIC ON and OFF command frames sent in Basic Command Class.
Only the BASIC ON command frame sent in Basic Command Class.
Only the BASIC OFF command frame sent in Basic Command Class.

The command frame sent at the moment of motion detection. Further motion detections, during the cancellation time, will not result in sending the association. The value other than 0 allows to turn ON an associated device. In case of the Dimmer, the value of 255 means turning ON at the last memorized state, e.g. the Dimmer turned ON at 30% and turned OFF using the value of 255, and then turned OFF, will be turned ON at 30%, i.e. the last memorized state.
Choose value for BASIC ON command frame.

The command frame sent at the moment of motion alarm cancellation, after cancellation delay time specified in parameter 6. The value of 0 allows to turn a device OFF while the value of 255 allows to turn ON a device. In case of the Dimmer, the value of 255 means turning ON at the last memorized state, e.g. the Dimmer turned ON at 30% and turned OFF using the value of 255, and then turned OFF, will be turned ON at 30%, i.e. the last memorized state.
Choose value for BASIC OFF command frame.

The parameter determines the changes in forces acting on the Fibaro Motion Sensor resulting in tamper alarm being reported - g-force acceleration. Available settings: 0 - 121 (0,08 - 2g; multiply by 0,016g; 0 = tamper inactive)
Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled. Another tampering detected during the countdown to cancellation will not extend the delay.
The parameter determines the behaviour of tamper alarm and how it reports. It is an advanced feature serving much more functions than just detection of tampering.

Tamper and earthquake detector. Function may be used as a simple seismograph. Two reports including the strength of shock are always sent. First, right after the detection and second (value=0) after tamper alarm cancellation delay time.
Tamper and orientation in space. Three reports are sent right after tamper alarm cancellation delay time.
The parameter determines if a tamper cancellation report is sent.
Do not send tamper cancellation report.

The parameter determines whether the tamper alarm frame will or will not be sent in broadcast mode. Alarm frames sent in broadcast mode can be received by all of the devices within communication range (if they accept such frames). When Fibaro Motion Sensor is operating in protected mode (secure mode), the value should remain default. Device operating in protected mode doesn’t send frames in broadcast mode.
Tamper alarm reported to association groups.
Tamper alarm reported in broadcast mode to 3rd association group.

The parameter determines whether the tamper alarm frame will or will not be sent in broadcast mode. Alarm frames sent in broadcast mode may be received by all of the devices within communication range (if they accept such frames). When Fibaro Motion Sensor is running in protected mode (secure mode), the value should remain default. Device operating in protected mode do not send frames in broadcast mode.
Tamper alarm reported to association groups.
Tamper alarm reported in broadcast mode to 5th association group.
The parameter determines the change in light intensity level resulting in illumination report being sent to the main controller.
Define the light intensity level. 0=no reports
Time interval between consecutive illumination reports. The reports are sent even if there are no changes in the light intensity.
The parameter determines the change in level of temperature resulting in temperature report being sent to the main controller.
Define change in level of temperature. Available settings: 0 - 255 (0,1-25,5°C,; 0 = reports are not sent)
The parameter determines how often the temperature will be measured. The shorter the time, the more frequently the temperature will be measured, but the battery life will shorten.
Define the interval of consecutive measurements. 0 = temperature will not be measured
The parameter determines how often the temperature reports will be sent to the main controller.
Define the time interval for reports that will be sent. 0 = no reports
The value to be added to the actual temperature, measured by the sensor (temperature compensation).
Define the value of added temperature. Available settings: -1000 - 1000 (-100°C – 100°C)

The parameter determines the way in which LED diode behaves after motion has been detected. Values from 1 to 9 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion. No other motion will be indicated until alarm is cancelled. Values from 10 to 18 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion and one short blink each time the motion is detected again. Values from 19 to 26 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion and two short blinks each time the motion is detected again.
LED colour depends on the temperature. Set by parameters 86 and 87.
Flashlight mode - LED glows in white for 10 seconds.
LED colour depends on the temperature. Set by parameters 86 and 87.
Flashlight mode - LED glows in white through 10 sec. Each next detected motion extends the glowing by next 10 seconds.
LED colour depends on the temperature. Set by parameters 86 and 87.
The parameter determines the brightness of LED when indicating motion.
Define the level of brightness. Available settings: 0 - 100 (1 - 100%; 0 = brightness determined by the ambient lighting - see parameters 82 and 83)

name.lang: AMBIENT ILLUMINATION LEVEL BELOW WHICH LED BRIGHTNESS IS SET TO 1%

description.lang: The parameter is relevant only when the parameter 81 is set to 0.
Define the parameter. Available settings: 0 to parameter 83 value (0-32766 lux)

name.lang: AMBIENT ILLUMINATION LEVEL ABOVE WHICH LED BRIGHTNESS IS SET TO 100%

description.lang: The parameter is relevant only when the parameter 81 is set to 0.
Define the parameter. Available settings: parameter 82 value to 32767 (1-32767 lux)

name.lang: MINIMUM TEMPERATURE RESULTING IN BLUE LED ILLUMINATION

description.lang: This parameter is relevant only when parameter 80 has been properly configured.
Define the minimum temperature. Available settings: 0 to parameter 87 value (0-255°C)

name.lang: MAXIMUM TEMPERATURE RESULTING IN RED LED ILLUMINATION

description.lang: This parameter is relevant only when parameter 80 has been properly configured.
Define the maximum temperature. Available settings: parameter 86 value to 255 (0-255°C)
Indicating mode resembles a police car (white, red and blue).
LED does not indicate tamper alarm.

The lower the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor.

Period of time through which the PIR sensor is “blind” (insensitive) to motion. After this time period the PIR sensor will be again able to detect motion. The longer the insensitivity period, the longer the battery life. If the sensor is required to detect motion quickly, the time period may be shortened. Sets the number of moves required for the PIR sensor to report motion. The lower the value, the less sensitive the PIR sensor. It’s not recommended to modify this parameter settings.
Define amount of pulses. Formula to calculate the number of pulses: pulses = (value + 1)

Period of time during which the number of moves set in parameter 3 must be detected in order for the PIR sensor to report motion. The higher the value, the more sensitive the PIR sensor. It’s not recommended to modify this parameter setting. Formula to calculate the time: time [s] = 4 x (value + 1)

Motion alarm will be cancelled in the main controller and the associated devices after the period of time set in this parameter. Any motion detected during the cancellation delay time countdown will result in the countdown being restarted. In case of small values, below 10 seconds, the value of parameter 2 must be modified (PIR sensor’s “Blind Time”).

The parameter determines the part of day in which the PIR sensor will be active. This parameter influences only the motion reports and associations. Tamper, light intensity and temperature measurements will be still active, regardless of this parameter settings.
PIR sensor active during the day only
PIR sensor active during the night only
The parameter defines the difference between night and day, in terms of light intensity, used in parameter 8.
Set the parameter for light intensity.

The parameter determines the command frames sent in 1-st association group, assigned to PIR sensor. Values of BASIC ON and BASIC OFF command frames may be modified by dedicated parameters (14 and 16).
BASIC ON and OFF command frames sent in Basic Command Class.
Only the BASIC ON command frame sent in Basic Command Class.
Only the BASIC OFF command frame sent in Basic Command Class.

The command frame sent at the moment of motion detection. Further motion detections, during the cancellation time, will not result in sending the association. The value other than 0 allows to turn ON an associated device. In case of the Dimmer, the value of 255 means turning ON at the last memorized state, e.g. the Dimmer turned ON at 30% and turned OFF using the value of 255, and then turned OFF, will be turned ON at 30%, i.e. the last memorized state.
Choose value for BASIC ON command frame.

The command frame sent at the moment of motion alarm cancellation, after cancellation delay time specified in parameter 6. The value of 0 allows to turn a device OFF while the value of 255 allows to turn ON a device. In case of the Dimmer, the value of 255 means turning ON at the last memorized state, e.g. the Dimmer turned ON at 30% and turned OFF using the value of 255, and then turned OFF, will be turned ON at 30%, i.e. the last memorized state.
Choose value for BASIC OFF command frame.

The parameter determines the changes in forces acting on the Fibaro Motion Sensor resulting in tamper alarm being reported - g-force acceleration. Available settings: 0 - 121 (0,08 - 2g; multiply by 0,016g; 0 = tamper inactive)
Time period after which a tamper alarm will be cancelled. Another tampering detected during the countdown to cancellation will not extend the delay.
The parameter determines the behaviour of tamper alarm and how it reports. It is an advanced feature serving much more functions than just detection of tampering.

Tamper and earthquake detector. Function may be used as a simple seismograph. Two reports including the strength of shock are always sent. First, right after the detection and second (value=0) after tamper alarm cancellation delay time.
Tamper and orientation in space. Three reports are sent right after tamper alarm cancellation delay time.
The parameter determines if a tamper cancellation report is sent.
Do not send tamper cancellation report.

The parameter determines whether the tamper alarm frame will or will not be sent in broadcast mode. Alarm frames sent in broadcast mode can be received by all of the devices within communication range (if they accept such frames). When Fibaro Motion Sensor is operating in protected mode (secure mode), the value should remain default. Device operating in protected mode doesn’t send frames in broadcast mode.
Tamper alarm reported to association groups.
Tamper alarm reported in broadcast mode to 3rd association group.

The parameter determines whether the tamper alarm frame will or will not be sent in broadcast mode. Alarm frames sent in broadcast mode may be received by all of the devices within communication range (if they accept such frames). When Fibaro Motion Sensor is running in protected mode (secure mode), the value should remain default. Device operating in protected mode do not send frames in broadcast mode.
Tamper alarm reported to association groups.
Tamper alarm reported in broadcast mode to 5th association group.
The parameter determines the change in light intensity level resulting in illumination report being sent to the main controller.
Define the light intensity level. 0=no reports
Time interval between consecutive illumination reports. The reports are sent even if there are no changes in the light intensity.
The parameter determines the change in level of temperature resulting in temperature report being sent to the main controller.
Define change in level of temperature. Available settings: 0 - 255 (0,1-25,5°C,; 0 = reports are not sent)
The parameter determines how often the temperature will be measured. The shorter the time, the more frequently the temperature will be measured, but the battery life will shorten.
Define the interval of consecutive measurements. 0 = temperature will not be measured
The parameter determines how often the temperature reports will be sent to the main controller.
Define the time interval for reports that will be sent. 0 = no reports
The value to be added to the actual temperature, measured by the sensor (temperature compensation).
Define the value of added temperature. Available settings: -1000 - 1000 (-100°C – 100°C)

The parameter determines the way in which LED diode behaves after motion has been detected. Values from 1 to 9 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion. No other motion will be indicated until alarm is cancelled. Values from 10 to 18 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion and one short blink each time the motion is detected again. Values from 19 to 26 = single long blink at the moment of reporting motion and two short blinks each time the motion is detected again.
LED colour depends on the temperature. Set by parameters 86 and 87.
Flashlight mode - LED glows in white for 10 seconds.
LED colour depends on the temperature. Set by parameters 86 and 87.
Flashlight mode - LED glows in white through 10 sec. Each next detected motion extends the glowing by next 10 seconds.
LED colour depends on the temperature. Set by parameters 86 and 87.
The parameter determines the brightness of LED when indicating motion.
Define the level of brightness. Available settings: 0 - 100 (1 - 100%; 0 = brightness determined by the ambient lighting - see parameters 82 and 83)

name.lang: AMBIENT ILLUMINATION LEVEL BELOW WHICH LED BRIGHTNESS IS SET TO 1%

description.lang: The parameter is relevant only when the parameter 81 is set to 0.
Define the parameter. Available settings: 0 to parameter 83 value (0-32766 lux)

name.lang: AMBIENT ILLUMINATION LEVEL ABOVE WHICH LED BRIGHTNESS IS SET TO 100%

description.lang: The parameter is relevant only when the parameter 81 is set to 0.
Define the parameter. Available settings: parameter 82 value to 32767 (1-32767 lux)

name.lang: MINIMUM TEMPERATURE RESULTING IN BLUE LED ILLUMINATION

description.lang: This parameter is relevant only when parameter 80 has been properly configured.
Define the minimum temperature. Available settings: 0 to parameter 87 value (0-255°C)

name.lang: MAXIMUM TEMPERATURE RESULTING IN RED LED ILLUMINATION

description.lang: This parameter is relevant only when parameter 80 has been properly configured.
Define the maximum temperature. Available settings: parameter 86 value to 255 (0-255°C)
Indicating mode resembles a police car (white, red and blue).
LED does not indicate tamper alarm.

RGBW Modul mit PWM Ausgang zur Steuerung von LED, RGB, RGBW Streifen, Halogen Leuchten. Gesteurerte Geräte könne mit 12 oder 24 V DC betrieben werden. Zusätzlich unterstützt das Gerät den Betrieb von bis zu vier 0-10V Analog-Sensoren wie Temperatur-, Feuchtigkeits-, Wind-, Luftqualitäts- und Helligkeitssensoren.

RGBW Controller uses PWM output signal, which enables it to control LED, RGB, RGBW strips, halogen lights and fans. Controlled devices may be powered by 12 or 24 VDC. In addition the device supports up to four, 0V - 10V analog sensors, such as temperature sensor, humidity sensors, wind sensors, air quality sensors, light sensors, etc.

RGBW контроллер с возможностью плавного регулирования света для управления LED, RGB, RGBW лентами, галогенными лампами и вентиляторами. Питается от 12В или 24В. Возможно подключение до 4 аналоговых датчиков 0В - 10В, таких как датчики: температуры, влажности, силы ветра, качество воздуха, освещенности и т.д.

inclusionNote.lang: Dreifaches Drücken der B Taste oder Auto-Inkludierung durch einfaches Anschließen der Spannungsversorgung.
Tripple Click on Button B or autoinclude by simple connecting the voltage supply.
Тройное нажатие на кнопку B или автовключение, если просто подать питание.

description.lang: sendet Gerätestatus. Nur ein Gerät sollte in diese Gruppe. Standardmäßig der Primärcontroller.
reports device status. Only one device may be assigned to this group, main controller by default

verbunden mit IN4 Eingang - sendet Control Frame zu assoziiertem Gerät jedesmal wenn Gerätestatus sich ändert (An/Aus).

verbunden mit IN3 Eingang - sendet Control Frame zu assoziiertem Gerät jedesmal wenn Gerätestatus sich ändert (An/Aus).
assigned to IN3 input - sends control frame to associated devices each time the device state changes (ON/OFF)
verbunden mit IN2 Eingang - sendet Control Frame zu assoziiertem Gerät jedesmal wenn Gerätestatus sich ändert (An/Aus).
assigned to IN2 input - sends control frame to associated devices each time the device state changes (ON/OFF)
verbunden mit IN1 Eingang - sendet Control Frame zu assoziiertem Gerät jedesmal wenn Gerätestatus sich ändert (An/Aus).
assigned to IN1 input - sends control frame to associated devices each time the device state changes (ON/OFF)

name.lang: ALL ON / ALL OFF function activation

description.lang: Aktivieren/Deaktivieren der Alles An/ Alles Aus Funktion
Activation/deactivation of ALL ON/ALL OFF functions
Параметр позволяет настроить, будет ли модуль реагировать на широковещательные команды "Включить всё" и "Выключить всё".
Alles An inaktiv, Alles Aus inaktiv
ALL ON inactive ALL OFF inactive
Игнорировать команду Включить всё, Игнорировать команду Выключить всё
Alles An inaktiv, Alles Aus aktiv
ALL ON inactive ALL OFF active
Игнорировать команду Включить всё, Реагировать на команду Выключить всё
Alles An aktiv, Alles Aus inaktiv
ALL ON active ALL OFF inactive
Реагировать на команду Включить всё, Игнорировать команду Выключить всё
Alles An aktiv, Alles Aus aktiv
ALL ON active ALL OFF active
Реагировать на команду Включить всё, Реагировать на команду Выключить всё
MODE1, Bsp.: ändern der Sätigung von 0% zu 99%, Parameter 9: Stufe = 5, Parameter 10: Zeit zwischen Schritten: 10ms.
MODE1, Example: change saturation level from 0% to 99%, Parameter 9: Step = 5, Parameter 10: Time between steps: 10ms.
Пример, если выбран Режим 1, то изменение яркости от 0% до 99% задается так: Параметр 9 - Шаг = 5, Параметр 10 - Время между шагами = 10мс.
Режим 1 (связанные параметры: 9 - значение шага, 10 - время между шагами)
MODE2 (verbundene Parameter: 11-Zeit zur Änderung des Wertes, wichtig für RGB/RGBW)
MODE2 (related parameters: 11-time to change value, relevant for RGB/RGBW)

Время изменения от начального до конечного значения

description.lang: Der Minimale Wert kann nicht höher sein, als der Maximalwert.
The minimum level cannot be upper than maximum level.
Минимальный уровень не может быть больше максимального уровня.
Standard Wert: 4369 gesteuertes Gerät: RGBW, Kippschalter Eingang (NORMAL MODE). Aller 4 Bit für entsprechendem IN/OUT Kanal.
Default setting: 4369 Controlled device: RGBW, toggle switch inputs (NORMAL MODE). Each 4bit refer to given IN/OUT (channel) settings.
По умолчанию: 4369. Это означает что, управляемое устройство: RGBW, входы работают с выключателем (Нормальный режим). Каждый из 4 битов настраивает свой канал входа/выхода.
